document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae, Sparianthinae) from the Neotropical region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae, Sparianthinae) from the Neotropical region

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sparianthis amazonica Simon, 1880 : 340
. Simon 1897 : 68 , fig. 61 ; Platnick 2013 .

03° 22 ’S
,
64 ° 42 ’W
), Amazonas, Brazil , (MNHN 4206 , examined).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15 – 18.
Uaiuara amazonica (Simon)
comb. nov.
, male. 15 right chelicerae, ventral view; 16 endite, detail showing serrula; 17 metatarsus I, trilobate membrane, ventral view; 18 tarsus I, trichobothria. Scale lines: 100µm: 15, 17; 10µm: 16; 20µm: 18.

FIGURES 19 – 22.
Uaiuara amazonica (Simon)
comb. nov .
19 male, tarsus I, tarsal organ; 20 male, metatarsus IV, detail showing preening comb; 21 male, tarsus I, claws, retrolateral view; 22 female, left pedipalp, claw, retrolateral view. Scale lines: 1µm: 19; 200µm: 20, 21; 10µm: 22.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Males of
Uaiuara amazonica (Simon)
comb. nov.
resemble those of
U. jirau
sp. nov.
in the short retrolateral groove on the palp, reaching less than half the cymbium length ( Figs 30 , 42 ) and those of
U. dianae
sp. nov.
in the lack of strong hairs along the groove ( Figs 30 , 38 ). They are distinguished from both species by the slightly sclerotized conductor (
Fig. 29
) and long, laminar dRTA (
Fig. 30
) in the male palps. The females resemble those of
U. ope
sp. nov.
in the epigyne with lateral lobes projecting anteriorly into the median septum ( Figs 31 , 47 ) and
U. dianae
sp. nov.
by the projections of the lateral lobes large and reaching in length the posterior margin of the median septum ( Figs. 31 , 39 ). They are distinguished from both species by the median septum rebordered and as long as wide (wider in both
U. dianae
sp. nov.
and
U. ope
sp. nov.
) (
Fig. 31
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 23 – 28.
Uaiuara amazonica
(Simon)
comb. nov .
23–25 male (23 ALS, 24 PMS, 25 PLS); 26–28 female (26 ALS, 27 PMS, 28 PLS) (Map = major ampullate gland spigot; map = minor ampullate gland spigot; nb = nubin). Scale lines: 50µm: 23, 25; 10µm: 24, 26, 27; 100µm: 28.

FIGURES 29 – 32.
Uaiuara amazonica
(Simon)
comb. nov .
29–30 male, MUSM (Puerto Maldonado), left palp (29 ventral, 30 retrolateral view); 31–32 female MUSM (Pakitza) (31 epigyne, ventral view, 32 vulva, dorsal view). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Female (IBSP 137205 ):
Coloration pattern as in male, darker at prosoma, legs and pedipalps and with opisthosoma pale brown (
Fig. 2
). Total length 6.6 . Prosoma: 2.8 long, 2.4 wide. Opisthosoma: 3.6 long, 2.4 wide. Eyes: diameters: 0.20 , 0.16 , 0.12 , 0.16 ; interdistances: 0.16 , 0.06 , 0.26 , 0.20 , 0.12 , 0.06 . Legs: I: 9.5 ( 2.8 , 1.4 , 2.6 , 2.1 , 0.6 ); II: 10.0 (3.0, 1.4 , 2.7 , 2.2 , 0.7 ); III: 7.7 ( 2.4 , 1.0, 1.8 , 1.9 , 0.6 ); IV: 9.4 ( 2.7 , 1.1 , 2.2 , 2.6 , 0.8 ). Spination: femur III: r 1 - 0-1 ; tibiae I–II:
v 8
pairs; tibia III: d0- 0-1 . Epigyne: epigynal field longer than wide. Vulva: LP slightly curved and divergent; gp inconspicuous; fertilization ducts short and slender, pointing away from each other (
Fig. 32
).
Variation. Males (n = 10 ) total length 5.7–7.7 ; prosoma length 2.5 –3.0; femur I length 2.6–3.3 . Females (n = 10 ): total length 6.0– 7.7 ; prosoma length 2.4–3.3 ; femur I length 2.4–3.1 .
